title: Distordia NFT Marketplace Standard
description: Schema for NFT assets to be tokenized and traded on the Distordia on-chain marketplace. Assets use Nexus basic format with open image URLs — no off-site storage required.
maxSize: 1KB (system fields use ~180 bytes, ~820 bytes available for data)

nft-name.description: Display name of the NFT. Immutable once created.

image.description: Direct URL to the NFT image. Must be a publicly accessible URL (e.g. HTTPS). No IPFS or on-site storage — the image lives at this open URL.

collection.description: Collection name to group related NFTs (e.g. 'CryptoKitties', 'Distordia Originals').

creator.description: Creator name, alias, or namespace. Establishes provenance.

external_url.description: External link for additional context (artist portfolio, project page, etc.).

naming.description: Asset register name. Slug derived from nft-name (lowercase, alphanumeric + hyphens, max 32 chars). Timestamp ensures uniqueness.

tokenization.description: NFTs must be tokenized before they can be traded on the Nexus on-chain marketplace. Tokenization creates a fungible token linked to the asset, enabling fractional or full ownership trading.

params.name: Token name (e.g. nft-cosmic-dragon-token)
params.supply: Total token supply (1 for unique NFT, >1 for fractional)

notes: Token supply of 1 with 0 decimals = unique NFT (1:1 ownership)
Token supply >1 = fractional ownership (e.g. 100 tokens = 100 shares)
Once tokenized, ownership transfers happen via token trading, not asset transfer
Tokenization is irreversible — the asset remains linked to the token permanently

trading.description: Tokenized NFTs are traded on the Nexus on-chain P2P marketplace using TOKEN/NXS pairs.

params.txid: Transaction ID of the order to fill
Transaction ID of the order to cancel

examples._comment: Example NFT asset as returned by Nexus API
examples.name: nft-cosmic-dragon-1738857600000
examples.description: A celestial dragon soaring through the Nexus nebula. Part of the Distordia Originals genesis collection.
examples.creator: ArtistAlpha

nexus.createCommand: assets/create/asset format=basic name=nft-{slug}-{timestamp} distordia-type=nft status=active nft-name='{name}' description='{desc}' image='{url}' category='{cat}' collection='{col}' creator='{creator}' external_url='{ext}'

notes: Uses basic format (not JSON) so individual fields are queryable via Nexus register API
Image must be a publicly accessible HTTPS URL — no IPFS, no on-site storage
1KB total asset limit — keep descriptions concise (~256 chars max)
Asset creation costs ~2 NXS; tokenization costs ~2 NXS; listing is free
nft-name is immutable; description, category, collection, and external_url can be updated
Fractional ownership: set token supply > 1 during tokenization to enable shared ownership
